intro: Arachnothryx belizensis var. longiloba, commonly known as the long-stemmed spider-thryx, is a flowering plant native to Central America. It belongs to the Leguminosae family and is characterized by its climbing habit and trifoliate leaves. The plant produces small, clustered flowers that are typically white or pale pink, followed by legume-like pods containing seeds. It thrives in humid, tropical environments and is often found in secondary forests and disturbed areas. Its botanical features make it an interesting subject for ecological and horticultural study.
